p: Epidemic nodes were distinguished by the number of cases/node: 5% (8/157) of all epidemic nodes reported over 60 epidemic days included 23% of all cases (132/572, Table S1). That feature displayed a Pareto’s ‘20∶80 pattern’: a small percentage of nodes was associated with >4 times more cases (23/5 = 4.6) than expected under the assumption of an equal number of cases per node.
